result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman E Boose Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: COUNT 2. Defendant may have release for work if employed at the time of revocation. Defendant may have release to the Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes: Court authorized expungment upon successful completion of all conditions of probation.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: COUNT 1. Defendant may have release for work if employed at the time of revocation. Defendant may have release to the Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman E Boose Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing. Court ordered this matter adjourned to allow the defendant additional time to work and obtain treatment. Case adjourned for continued sentencing hearing in Branch 25. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

As to COUNT 1 AMENDED and COUNT 2 AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1: Receiving Stolen Property (<$2500) - PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 943.34(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

COUNT 2: Criminal Trespass - PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 943.14, 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived formal reading.

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are still working towards a resolution in this matter. Defense counsel recently turned over additional information to the State which the State needs to follow up on. Court granted joint request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, the parties requested another date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55-A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court granted joint request and ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing before Branch 25.  All terms and conditions of bail were ordered to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  Defense requests time to review recently received discovery materials with the defendant; motion for adjournment granted by the court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Norman E Boose not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Schroeder requested another date; possible new charges.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date; negotiations and additional investigation pending.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sergey K., the address of the offense or Co-Defendant Reginald Harris

Defendant Norman E Boose in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Norman E Boose in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
